summary: This is an email exchange from August 2020 discussing the unsealing of Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition in litigation before Judge Preska. The correspondents express concerns about victim confidentiality, noting that the documents have victim names redacted, and reference ongoing legal strategy involving attorney David Boies.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Her deposition is being unsealed in litigation before Judge Preska, raising concerns about victim confidentiality.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Referenced in the context of ongoing legal fighting; the correspondents plan to ask him about the unsealing schedule.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: Presiding over the litigation where Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition is being unsealed.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Maxwell in the context of individuals who approached and interacted with victims.

connections.description: Both are mentioned together as individuals who approached and interacted with victims.
Boies is involved in the legal proceedings concerning the unsealing of Maxwell's deposition.

events.title: Briefing deadline in Circuit Court
events.description: The Circuit Court has given parties until August 20, 2020, to brief the issue related to the unsealing of documents.

events.title: Deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell from May 2016 is referenced as being unsealed, with victim names redacted.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition from May 2016 is being unsealed in litigation before Judge Preska.
The documents have victim names redacted to protect confidentiality, though the victims' interactions with Epstein and Maxwell were previously commented on in the press.
There is ongoing legal strategy and 'fighting' involving attorney David Boies regarding the unsealing process.
The Circuit Court set a briefing deadline of August 20, 2020, for the parties involved.
